page.title: 06RELIGION BREDGAR CHURCH
page.content: St. John the Baptist Church in Bredgar belongs to the church of England.The church has close links with Bredgar primary school which is also governed by the church.During the summer months the children attend a short service on Wednesday morning.The church dates back to medieval times,but the hard wooden pews are victorian. Despite having five parishes to cover the vicar still manages at least two services a week.The average congregation is about twenty nine.There are no bell ringers, this being done by electricity. There is a Sunday School and a small Bible class.The church magazine comes out ten times a year.The vicar visits sick people and newcomers to the village.On average the church is used for weddings about four times a year.
